intro: Whytockia arunachalensis, commonly known as the Arunachal lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest habitats at high elevations. It is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
